intro: Steenhammera, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plants typically have basal leaves and produce showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white or pink petals. Steenhammera species are often used in ornamental gardening due to their attractive blooms and adaptability to various soil types. They are also known for their ability to thrive in full sun and well-drained soils.
